meanings.definition: Spoliates (verb): to strip of possessions or value
meanings.sent1: The thief spoliates the house of its valuables.
meanings.sent2: The hurricane spoliates entire towns, leaving nothing behind.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon spoliates the picnic basket, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: Time spoliates us of our youth, leaving only memories behind.
meanings.sent5: The greedy king spoliates his subjects of their hard-earned wealth.

meanings.definition: Spoliates (noun): the act of plundering or looting
meanings.sent1: The spoliates of ancient artifacts from the tomb were a great loss.
meanings.sent2: The spoliates of the museum shocked the community.
meanings.sent3: The pirate's spoliates were displayed proudly on his ship.
meanings.sent4: The spoliates of the enemy's camp were a strategic victory.
meanings.sent5: The spoliates of the treasure chest were carefully hidden away.
